channel.title: Ethereum Concepts on Raja Kesari
channel.description: Recent content in Ethereum Concepts on Raja Kesari

item.title: Ethereum Virtual Machine
item.description: Before diving into EVM, let’s try to understand a bit more of What an “Account” meant in Ethereum world and how the “Transaction” effect the World State. Please go through the links, if you have not already done.

item.title: Ethereum Virtual Machine
item.description: Before diving into EVM, let’s try to understand a bit more of What an “Account” meant in Ethereum world and how the “Transaction” effect the World State. Please go through the links, if you have not already done.

item.title: Smart Contract
item.description: To understand the need for a smart Contract in Ethereum framework, we should revisit the Transaction where we discussed that all we can do is one kind of Transaction.

item.title: Smart Contract
item.description: To understand the need for a smart Contract in Ethereum framework, we should revisit the Transaction where we discussed that all we can do is one kind of Transaction.

item.title: Transaction
item.description: Taking the same example of a Cricket match from World State, we will see why using “a ball bowled” as the transaction is right decision.

item.title: Transaction
item.description: Taking the same example of a Cricket match from World State, we will see why using “a ball bowled” as the transaction is right decision.

item.title: World State
item.description: Ethereum, or for that matter any blockchain does not store the data like normal databases. Blockchain stores the ‘State’ of the ethereum world.

item.title: World State
item.description: Ethereum, or for that matter any blockchain does not store the data like normal databases. Blockchain stores the ‘State’ of the ethereum world.

item.title: Accounts In Ethereum Context
item.description: The concept of Blockchain it self is based on change of the state, to be precise “storing of every state change”. We can call this state-changing “action” a “transaction”. To do these transactions there has to be some entities which can be recognized by the blockchain in our case Ethereum. Let’s call these entities “Accounts”. The Ethereum blockchain recognize these “entities that are capable of doing transactions”(We just named them as Accounts) with their Address.

item.title: Accounts In Ethereum Context
item.description: The concept of Blockchain it self is based on change of the state, to be precise “storing of every state change”. We can call this state-changing “action” a “transaction”. To do these transactions there has to be some entities which can be recognized by the blockchain in our case Ethereum. Let’s call these entities “Accounts”. The Ethereum blockchain recognize these “entities that are capable of doing transactions”(We just named them as Accounts) with their Address.
